change.item: MSS19740002 converted from EAD 1.0 to 2002 by v1to02.xsl (sy2003-10-15).

did.head: Overview of the Collection
did.repository: Archives & Special Collections at the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center.
did.abstract: The collection consists of letters to James Koller from various friends and colleagues, including Philip Whalen, and original manuscripts and typescripts of Koller's poetry and novels.

bioghist.head: Biography of
bioghist.p: Born in 1936 in Oak Park, Illinois, Koller is an American poet, novelist, editor and publisher. Koller obtained his B.A. from North Central College in Naperville, Illinois in 1958; he then moved to San Francisco where he became the editor of Coyote's Journal, and the publisher of Coyote Books. He later moved with the magazine to New Mexico, and then to Maine. Koller has authored twenty-seven collections of poetry and four novels, and was a National Endowment for the Arts fellowship recipient in both 1968 and 1973.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection primarily consists of letters to James Koller from various friends and colleagues (including Philip Whalen) and original manuscripts and typescripts of Koller's poetry and novels. The materials date from 1959-1986. Dan Cushman's novel Stay Away, Joe (New York: Viking Press, 1953) was originally included in the collection, attached to Bill Deemer's February 6, 1984 letter to Koller.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Archives and Special Collections have a substantial array of alternative and small press literary collections. For detailed information on these collections please contact the curator or ask at the reference desk.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Series I: Correspondence has been arranged alphabetically according to the last name of each letter's author. Series II: Writings has been re-foldered to accommodate size, and arranged alphabetically according to the name of each piece. Photographs have been separated from their original letters or manuscripts and placed in envelopes in Series III, arranged alphabetically according to their description.

bibref.title: Who's Who In Writers, Editors & Poets, 1989-90,

controlaccess.p: This record series is indexed under the following controlled access subject terms.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: There are no access restrictions on this collection.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item, Folder #], James Koller Papers. Archives and Special Collections at the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center, University of Connecticut Libraries.
